alert.note: Alert for Owl Creek and Bridger Mountains; Southwest Big Horn Basin (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 01 at 12:43PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Hot Springs County through 130 PM MDT... At 1242 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles east of Anchor Dam, which is also 21 miles west of Thermopolis, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of south central Hot Springs County. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Owl Creek and Bridger Mountains; Southwest Big Horn Basin
